description: Borrowed from Russian аппара́т (apparát, “apparatus, apparat”). Doublet of apparatus.

entries.meaning: The Soviet machinery of state bureaucratic administration, or a similar communistic structure.
examples: The second thing to absorb was that, behind all the spontaneity and eroticism and generalized “festival of the oppressed” merrymaking, a grim-faced Communist apparat was making preparations for an end to the revels and a serious seizure of the state.
